briefTitle: Mitigation of Major Hip Injury Due to Fall With a Smart Belt
officialTitle: Mitigation of Major Hip Injury Due to Fall in an At-Risk, Older Adult Population With a Wearable Smart Belt

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan, and Informed Consent Form

primary.measure: Major Hip Injuries Due to Serious Hip-impacting Fall
primary.description: The percent of subjects in the ITT population with major hip injuries due to serious hip-impacting falls.

secondary.measure: Number of Hip Fractures Related to Fall
secondary.description: The number of subjects in the ITT group with hip fractures related to a fall event.

secondary.measure: Number of Emergency Department Visits Related to Fall
secondary.description: The number of subjects in the ITT group with emergency department visits related to fall.

secondary.measure: Number of Hospitalizations Due to Fall
secondary.description: The number of subjects in the ITT group admitted to a hospital due to fall.

other.measure: Number and Severity of Adverse Events
other.description: An Adverse Event is any untoward medical occurrences in a patient or subject receiving an investigational medical device and does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with the device under investigation. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical device whether or not considered related to the medical device. Any fall event is considered an AE for this study. A Severe Adverse Event is any AE that results in death, is life-threatening, requires in-patient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization or results in persistent or significant disability/ incapacity.

other.measure: Number of Major Injuries Due to Fall
other.description: The number of major injuries that were due to a fall.
The fall rate for the intervention and the control group
Adherence to wearing of the study device in days/month
Compliance to wearing of the study device in hours/day average
Rate of airbag deployments that occurred while an intervention subject was not experiencing a serious hip-impacting fall.

other.measure: Accuracy of Study Device Airbag Deployment
other.description: Accuracy of the study device airbag deployment as designed is demonstrated in the number of hip fractures that occurred by intervention subjects wearing the device during serious hip-impacting falls.

Short version of the Falls Efficacy Scale International (where applicable for those deemed able to take the questionnaire (BIMS of 13-15)) to offer level of balance confidence as defined by the scale (range from 7 (no concern about falling) to 28 (severe concern about falling).
